John Abraham Makes A Valid Point On Why Celebrities Should Support Social Causes
John Abraham Makes A Valid Point On Why Celebrities Should Support Social Causes
During a recent media interaction, John Abraham expressed his opinion and said that he feels really nice when he sees his colleagues from Bollywood associate themselves with various kinds of social causes.
Many celebrities in the past have been associated with various social causes and this long list includes stars like Amitabh Bachchan, Akshay Kumar, Aamir Khan, and Salman Khan.
Talking about the same, John said,
Twitter
"It's very good. As a film industry person, I feel that it's great that more people are coming forward with various social causes. I think if you are in position and you have a platform, then you must do it."
He added that it's not something that India needs but it's something that's crucial for the entire world. He added,

"It's really nice to see that many people are working towards social causes because it's not just a good thing for our country but for the entire world."
John was spotted sporting a moustache for his upcoming film "Batla House". Talking about the same, he added,
"I have not completed shooting of the film. We are finishing one big schedule. Nowadays, everybody gets scared of me because I look like a cop."
His upcoming films also include "Romeo Akbar Walter" which slated to release on April 12 followed by "Batla House" which will hit the screens on Independence Day.
(With agency inputs)
